summary: Easier leveling at high levels and (slightly) harder leveling at low levels.
descriptionHtml:
[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Changes
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
v0.1.1
- Skill xp leveling is now adjusted to (roughly) match the gentler leveling curves (by changing the fSkillUseCurve game setting).
- UPDATE: I now provide an updated Flat version of the mod as an alternative to my other mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55004/?]LinearLeveling (Experimental)[/url].

[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Summary
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
Simple mod that changes the fXPLevelUpBase, fXPLevelUpMult and fSkillUseCurve game settings to make the leveling curve gentler (for milk drinkers like me :P ).

In vanilla Skyrim the experience points required to level up grows exponentially. This means that the player must endure endless tedious grinding at high levels. I'd rather have a more consistent and less painful leveling experience. This mod makes it easier to level up at higher levels and (slightly) harder to level up at lower levels.

[img]http://static-4.nexusmods.com/15/mods/110/images/54759-2-1403101441.png[/img]

[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Install
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
There are 3 main versions of the mod: Gentle, More Gentle, Very Gentle. Install only one. To get the intended experience I suggest starting a new game, but that's optional.

If you want xp to level up at a flat rate use the Flat version instead, or see my alternative mod [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/55004/?]LinearLeveling[/url] (requires SKSE and Community Uncapper though).

[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Uninstall
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
Safe to uninstall during an existing game.

[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Compatibility
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
No expected conflicts.

Works with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/1175/?]Skyrim --Community-- Uncapper[/url].
[i]Note: As a side effect this mod does increase the maximum possible level, but that's not the purpose of the mod. Rather, I aim to adjust the rate of leveling so that it's closer to a straight line than an exponential curve (and a little bit easier at high levels). [/i]

[color=orange][size=5]-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Details
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------[/size][/color]
Vanilla:
fXPLevelUpMult : 25
fXPLevelUpBase : 75
fSkillUseCurve : 1.95

Gentle:
fXPLevelUpMult : 15
fXPLevelUpBase : 225
fSkillUseCurve : 1.87

More Gentle:
fXPLevelUpMult : 10
fXPLevelUpBase : 300
fSkillUseCurve : 1.80

Very Gentle:
fXPLevelUpMult : 5
fXPLevelUpBase : 375
fSkillUseCurve : 1.72

Flat:
fXPLevelUpMult : 0
fXPLevelUpBase : 450
fSkillUseCurve : 1.68

Cheers,
Evildavo.
author: Evildavo
